question: Show total funded amount vs considered funded amount for each loan product ID
sql_query:
SELECT
    loanproductid AS Loan_Product_ID,
    SUM(fundedamount) AS Total_Funded_Amount,
    SUM(consideredfundedamount) AS Total_Considered_Funded_Amount
FROM
    fl_lms.loan_filters
GROUP BY
    loanproductid
ORDER BY
    loanproductid;

chart_analysis.reasoning: The data contains categorical values (loan_product_id) and two quantitative measures (total_funded_amount and total_considered_funded_amount) that need to be compared for each category. This structure is ideal for direct comparison visualizations.

suggested_charts.title: Total Funded vs. Considered Funded Amount per Loan Product
suggested_charts.reason: A grouped bar chart is excellent for comparing two distinct quantitative values across multiple categories. Each loan_product_id would have two bars, one for total_funded_amount and one for total_considered_funded_amount, making direct comparison straightforward.

suggested_charts.title: Total Funded and Considered Funded Amounts (Stacked)
suggested_charts.reason: A stacked bar chart could show the total_funded_amount as the base and the difference up to total_considered_funded_amount as a stack on top, effectively showing the total_considered_funded_amount as the full bar height. This is useful if the 'considered' amount is always greater and you want to visualize the 'gap'.

auto_chart.title: Total Funded vs. Considered Funded Amount per Loan Product
auto_chart.reason: A grouped bar chart provides the clearest and most direct side-by-side comparison of the two requested quantitative measures (total funded vs. considered funded amount) for each loan product ID, fulfilling the user's request precisely.
